Description: Tondo sherd of Attic red-figured pottery kylix with part of stem; interior, tondo framed by narrow band; inside, large calyx-krater drawn with relief contour. Inscription in added red. Exterior, black.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The shape of the krater suggests a date after 480.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 47, pl. XXVII, no.1)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 509, no. C72)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1500)
